general.headline: Impactful, Commercial, Snr HR leader with expertise in HRBP, OD/Talent and change across Tech, FMCG, Customer and Retail
general.description:
Senior HR Leader with 18+ years experience as a HRBP together with depth in HR program management and development, strategy, talent, planning and HR operations in businesses at various stages of maturity (mergers, growth, mature and new start ups) with both a local and international focus. 

I am a pragmatic and commercially astute HR leader with extensive experience leading large HR specialist and business partner teams teams across Technology/Digital, Operations, Customer, Retail and FMCG businesses.  Have evidence and passion for driving cultural change programmes and have played people stream lead roles in the delivery of new Operating/Service Delivery/HRIS systems and models across many of the business units I was part of. Strong influencer of both C-suite executives as well as front line leaders as a result of early HR foundations in supporting manufacturing facilities.

I have deep HR and OD development expertise together with a record of developing leadership, engagement, talent and capability interventions to support the realisation of business strategy.  I have developed a strong programme management reputation and am equally comfortable in the design and delivery of bespoke interventions as well as rolling up my sleeves and executing with rigour. 
 
Feedback supports that I am a respected HR Leader acknowledged for business and commercial foundations, paired with the ability to contribute to and drive strategic business decisions. I am proactive, collaborative and creative HR professional who drives for innovative solutions and am especially passionate about talent, development and diversity.

The business was also accountable for regional and local market leadership (media management and complex customer issue resolution); connecting with stakeholders in local communities to win in the local market.

Key achievements:
Business transformation program lead and significant restructuring 
Retail store footprint strategy review

general.headline: Specialising in placing Executive HR talent
general.description:
In my role as Principal Consultant, I specialise in placing executive HR talent in the Melbourne market.  My approach is to be hands-on and dedicated to every assignment. I like to work closely with my customers to provide a variety of options and solutions that meet the needs of each individual involved. I have a down-to-earth, honest style and enjoy working with clients and candidates over the long term. I am determined to improve my customer’s workplaces by assisting them to make good staffing decisions.

ABOUT ME
With over 10 years experience in the industry, I have a strong network of experienced HR and Talent Acquisition professionals who assist with the implementation of new structures, cultures, processes, and systems and building future talent within a variety of organisations. My priority is providing my clients with quality HR professionals to assist in growing their business through leaner and more productive workplaces and finding my customers the best jobs.

general.description:
With over 18 years of experience in HR and Talent Consulting, I am passionate and credible professional with a genuine interest in business and the human resources profession. I set high performance standards for myself and my team, and am committed to delivering the best outcomes for my customers. Customers working with me have access to deep industry knowledge, specialisation and experience, whilst being able to benefit from the systems, processes and networks of The Next Group. Customers can expect an honest approach, the highest level of integrity and someone that listens. This has allowed me to build a reputation around not only providing invaluable career development advice to candidates, but also to work closely with key industry professionals in the aim of establishing mutually beneficial relationships that extend beyond talent acquisition, to also offer insight into trends within the market, and to gain further knowledge into human resources issues. 

Leading a team of highly experienced and passionate Consultants specialising in HR Contracting and Interim Management solutions, we are committed to delivering great results, EXCEEDING EXPECTATIONS, receiving fantastic feedback (through our Net Promoter Scores) and CELEBRATING SUCCESS. This is what drives us! 

Personally I am a mother of two and aspiring ‘mother of the year’, an avid sailor who has won multiple state and club championships, a hobby farmer, and someone who loves meandering through Art Galleries and Museums.

For any queries, or HR Contracting and Interim Management needs in Melbourne, please don’t hesitate to contact me or the team on (03) 9664 0900.

jobs.description:
At The Next Step, HR is our passion. Since opening our doors in 1998, The Next Step has been dedicated to delivering outstanding customer services to the HR profession through our comprehensive suite of services for HR practitioners and the organisations that they serve. 

We know that in an ever increasingly changing world, HR functions need to step up to meet a new and diverse range of challenges whilst continuing to deliver great customer outcomes. To support this, The Next Step is dedicated to delivering a comprehensive range of integrated talent solutions to support HR professionals and businesses to achieve their goals.

The Next Step operates throughout Australia and has offices in Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane as well as the capability to provide international HR talent services through our partners in the Global HR Network.

The Next Step is the foundation and cornerstone business of The Next Group, a multi-faceted provider of human capital solutions and services which also comprises The Next Gen, The Safe Step and The HR Space. 

At The Next Step, WE CARE ……about your success

For more information about The Next Step, please refer to www.thenextstep.com.au

What’s more, we treat each client, candidate, and contractor with the attention and respect they deserve, as befits our corporate values: integrity, respect, collaboration, empowerment and responsibility. At Hudson, you get local expertise backed by global resources and a network of professionals. We’re always at work - recruiting, motivating and developing people in markets from Sydney to Hong Kong, Brussels to New York and every place in between.

general.headline: Managing Director
general.description:
Talent manager and entrepreneur in the niche vertical of procurement/supply chain and recruitment technology. Dedicated to enhancing demand and supply of procurement & supply chain talent globally through knowledge, process, people and patented technology. 

Part of the International Business Outsource Inc and a division of Bluefin Resources Group Jigsaw is the leading brand for specialist recruitment services in the niche of procurement and supply chain. Established in 2005 and acquired by Bluefin Resources in 2018, we manage a portfolio of 10,000 candidates globally and service roles across all industry sectors including financial services, manufacturing, mining, oil & gas and consulting. If you have time please visit www.jigsawtm.com for more information 

What separates our Group from other recruitment firms is our dedication to operational excellence. Like any good business, we do the simple things very well. Bluefin Resources and Jigsaw Talent Management has aligned our specialist verticals to niche skills sets, that are candidate short, hard to find and in demand. Our clients engage with Bluefin Resources Group because they want to attract and hire the best talent in the market, as opposed to just the talent on the market. The best talent is most likely to be already employed, be happy in their job and performing at a high level. The vast majority of the best talent is not active on LinkedIn or job boards. We call this pool of candidates Passive candidates. Our Group spend most of our time talking to the passive candidate market and using our extensive networks to identify the best performers and rising stars in each of our respective verticals

Specialties: Recruitment Solutions within the areas of Procurement, Supply Chain, Data Analytics, Risk Management, Marketing & Market Research, Digital, Technology, Investment & Wealth Management, Banking & Finance, Sales, Tax

jobs.description:
Managing Director of Jigsaw Talent Management

Evolving from Asia Pacific's leading procurement recruitment agency Jigsaw Search, Jigsaw Talent Management (JigsawTM) is an International technology & recruitment company offering a wide range of digital talent management solutions that optimise the entire procurement recruitment cycle.

With offices in both Australia (VIC, QLD, NSW) and the UK, JigsawTM exists to obtain, store and share key information through a digital cloud based platform that enables all aspects of human capital management to take place, from the sourcing and vetting of potential procurement employees, to the ongoing management of procurement experts once they have been added to your organisational chart.

JigsawTM provides these cutting edge recruitment processes through a series of unique and patented technology that enable our customers to both, build and manage their procurement organisational charts through a digital platform and (with the click of a button) either map or succession plan the external market to their specific business requirements.

Combined with JigsawTM's capability assessments and other real time market data, we enable our customers to have a constant comparison of their procurement department with the wider global procurement market and compare and interface with it in order to manage their entire procurement resources more strategically and with more certainty.

Specialties
Procurement Management, Procurement Director, Procurement Specialist, Strategic Sourcing Director, Strategic Sourcing Manager, Category Management, Vendor Mangement, SRM, Shared Services, Supply Chain Director, Supply Chain Manager

general.headline: CEO at FlexCareers | Global Ambassador at Women's Entrepreneurship Day | Changing the Way We Work | Speaker
general.description:
I am driven by making a difference in this world, through my passion for helping people, particularly to economically empower women.  I am a believer of challenging the norm, being curious and innovating, finding better and different ways of doing things, of connecting and collaborating. With over 20 years experience in business across a broad spectrum of industries throughout APAC I have worked both in companies and ran my own. 

I enjoy speaking at conferences and I am available to speak in Australia and Internationally on topics relating to women, entrepreneurship, gender equality, women in business, diversity, unconscious bias and related topics.

jobs.description:
FlexCareers is changing the way careers work. Our disruptive careers platform engineers game-changing technology to connect talented individuals with progressive employers offering flexible work. 

We've built a talent community of over 75,000 (70% women), and we attract 200+ new members daily - all looking to connect with flexible, supportive employers in Australia and New Zealand. 

But we're not just filling jobs, FlexCareers is helping to create workplaces of the future. 

FlexCareers are experts in workplace flexibility and gender diversity. We offer training, coaching and strategic consulting in workplace flexibility and diversity, and we have a strong track record in Return to Work program delivery.

We envisage a future where:
- flexible work is the norm, not the exception
- diverse teams are thriving, and leading by example
- life outside of work is valued, and work-life integration is encouraged and supported

Find out more about how to join Australia and New Zealand's fastest growing community of flexible, supportive employers, or become a member of our thriving talent community here:

WEDO World Ambassadors are the world’s leading women in business! Our mission is to alleviate poverty by empowering, celebrating and supporting women in business worldwide! WEDO Ambassadors create the movement in their countries by collaborating with Government Officials, Women’s Empowerment and Business Organizations/Foundations, and Influential Business People to support the mission. #ChooseWOMEN digital

21st June 2017 will be Australia’s inaugural Flexible Working Day.  Flexible Working Day is the brainchild of Vanessa Vanderhoek and has garnered the support of the Workplace Gender Equality Agency, Diversity Council of Australia, Women’s Agenda, The Parenthood and FlexCareers as well as Corporate Ambassadors & Supporters from PepsiCo, Holden, Medibank, PWC and more. 

So what’s it all about? There has been a lot of talk about flexible work for some time now and whilst organisations such as yours have done great work, it’s not a reality for many people who struggle to achieve this in their workplaces. Implementing and managing flexible work can be challenging as we know, and we are eager to make a difference in this area by showing how organisations can be more productive by enabling a flexible work environment.  Flexible Working Day 2017 is a bold and innovative initiative to promote and celebrate the benefits of working flexibly.

The theme for the day is Flexibility at Work Benefits Everyone, with the aim to increase awareness of the benefits of flexible work and to encourage people, managers and staff alike, to take action to implement flexibility in their workplaces. An energised and fun social media campaign will help gain momentum and supporters for the day. 
 
The Flexible Working Day website facilitates the engagement and provides readily accessible tips, tools and suggestions on how to support flexibility in the workplace. In our quest to promote and normalise flexible working arrangements, the website will also promote Flexpo 2017 – an avenue for organisations such as yours, to showcase approaches to flexible work.

WIN Australia is a registered not-for-profit organisation committed to bringing both Indigenous and non-Indigenous Australia together to forge an integrated and successful future, with opportunities for all people of this country.

Our pathway is through increasing the number of Indigenous women in leadership roles in organisations.

Our mandate is to empower and equip Indigenous women to excel in business leadership and lay a foundation for self-determination that creates a progressive pathway for all Indigenous people to be the creators of positive change, with equal opportunities and equitable pathways for all Australians.
Targeting Indigenous women will also benefit business – diversity contributes to high performing boards; investors – diversity drives up shareholder value; and people in the community at large who are demanding that Australia address the inequity and inequality which continues to exist, by supporting Indigenous women to be able to enjoy the same opportunities as other men and women in Australian society.

http://www.winaustralia.org.au/

jobs.jobTitle: Head of Strategy & Partnerships at Women as Entrepreneurs
jobs.description:
Our Vision
Women as Entrepreneurs was created with the vision to build, support and promote the Australian national community of like-minded aspiring and accomplished female entrepreneurs. With partnerships, empowerment and inspiration, WE encourage more women to bravely step into entrepreneurship, increasing the current 17% female presence in the Australian entrepreneurial space.

Why were Women as Entrepreneurs born?
We envision a world where women are represented equally in business. Not only because it is fair, but also because diversity drives innovation and results in a more competitive economy. We believe that if we challenge the outdated traditions in business and increase the numbers of women in entrepreneurship, we will empower communities, nations and shape a better world.

What do we do?
We organise top quality networking events where we have engaging and meaningful discussions 
We listen to inspiring guest speakers and learn from one another 
We promote entrepreneurship around Australia and grow our community

We work together with people like you: female entrepreneurs and business owners that are driven, inspiring and have big ideas. Whether you are starting a new business or need to take your existing business to the next level, Launch Pod will be there no matter what stage of the journey you are at. Through our free learning resources, e-courses or Pods and tools we want to make your ideas a reality, your business a success and create a more confident you. 

We work together with you to grow you and your business.

Come join the community www.thelaunchpod.com

•	Human Resources
•	Accounting /Finance
•	Marketing
•	Sales
•	Business Support
•	Technical and Operations

I specialise in senior HR appointments.  Over many years I have established a deep network across the HR community nationally.  I work with HR professionals  and provide career support, mentoring and coaching throughout their career.  I work with organisations to source and select the best talent and fit for their HR roles. Trust and integrity are  fundamental drivers in the services we provide.

general.headline: Partner and Co-founder at Fifth Frame
general.description:
I have spent 30 years consulting to organisations around the World about issues connecting their people to their business results.  The past few years my focus has sharpened on leadership and culture and the importance  of those two connected concepts for organisational survival as the world of work is significantly disrupted by technology in the next five to ten years.  

To be successful the best businesses, governments and not-for-profits will have to help their workforce navigate the collision of rapidly accelerating technology capability with thousands of years of human evolution and hundreds of years of slowly developed societal norms.  The answer is not black and white, our personal and collective future prosperity lies in how we choose to navigate these coming years of turmoil.

After twenty years working in global consulting businesses and partnerships and spending increasing amounts of time on internal and management tasks I am now focused on bringing the people expertise of Fifth Frame directly to clients.

jobs.description:
Fifth Frame is an Australian-based management consulting business which focuses on helping business and government bodies achieve success through their people.

Our clients range from small, nimble app developers to government infrastructure businesses, from big four banks to leading media organisations.  In short, anyone.  Because people issues are mostly solved by knowing how people tick, by understanding psychology and behavioural economics, and by applying deep academic research and years of practical experience; not complex models, toolkits or industry frameworks. 

There are some problems that require an army of consultants working on a "transformation" agenda, but more often we see the need for ongoing advice and counsel from a trusted partner.  If you are looking for an organisation to work with over the long term, to help you achieve the results you have been looking for, by getting the most out of your people then you might just have come to the right place...
www.fifthframe.com.au

Guiding and directing our Global network of close to 11,000 Partners and staff in the People and Organisation practice.  Bringing  together an un-matched combination of people in 138 countries with industry, mobility, business, talent, strategy, HR, analytics and technology expertise in one team.  Together we build tailored people and organisation solutions, with a deep understanding of each clients’ uniqueness and grounded in rigorous analysis and data-driven insight, to create lasting, differentiated value.  We help clients to implement organisational transformation, improve the effectiveness of their workforce, develop and move talent around their business and manage their human capital risks. We work from people strategy through to organisational execution.

PwC's Australian People business helps our clients to realise and discover the potential of their people…. by providing a single integrated people consulting and solutions service. Our services range from payroll and immigration solutions, through employment taxes and industrial relations advice to change management, organisation design, remuneration and leadership and culture consulting - and all points inbetween.

Gallup has a great range of well researched tools for connecting employees to their
      potential, primarily through their Q12 employee survey and their strengths approach.
      Occasionally organisations can be overtaken by an almost religious belief in things that
      
      are really just models reflecting reality, not actually reality itself.

A handful of us started and grew the Hewitt Associates business in Australia and New Zealand from nothing to a sizeable player in the Australian HR consulting market. From our offices in the Rocks in Sydney and in Melbourne, Auckland and Wellington we focused mainly on measuring and driving employee engagement for our clients. The "Best Employer....." Awards were the first of their kind in this market and a particular breakthrough in terms of driving organisations to recognise the importance of engagement in driving business outcomes.

Started out trying to apply a psychology degree somewhere and ended up in the executive remuneration space, firstly in Croydon with Noble Lowndes and then in Sydney with Cullen Egan Dell when an opportunity arose there. Exec rem is a great starting point for understanding organisations, roles and individual drivers of behaviour.

general.headline: Managing Partner at Blackhall & Pearl
general.description:
Blackhall & Pearl as a specialist board performance, risk management, enterprise governance and talent services advisory group that works with Boards, the C-Suite and senior management to enable them to achieve their strategic objectives. I lead to board practice, helping boards optimise their contribution, performance and efficiency.  I also help boards anticipate, understand and manage social and reputational risks sjm@blackhallpearl.com
I also work with Futureye, a consultancy that assists clients achieve a social licence to operate. Our expertise includes: social licence governance, strategy and execution, sustainability innovation, ethical branding, risk communication and participatory engagement.  stevenm@futureye.com
In my private capacity (CIVILITAS) I work with senior executives and boards to map and manage their organisation's reputational risks before they face a crisis, advises member organisations on how to maximise their impact and provides a sounding board and adviser to executives to help them succeed in new or changing roles.  sjmunchenberg@civilitas.com.au

jobs.description:
Blackhall & Pearl as a specialist board performance, risk management, enterprise governance and talent services advisory group that works with Boards, the C-Suite and senior management to enable them to achieve their strategic objectives.

As well as being involved in Blackhall & Pearl’s current practices, I work with clients to improve their ability to predict and manage social risks, those risks that arise when companies find themselves out of alignment with societal expectations.  I draw on my 30 years’ experience with such issues to provide practical insights that help companies navigate through an increasingly unpredictable world.

Futureye is a consultancy that assists clients achieve a social licence to operate. Our
      expertise includes: social licence governance, strategy and execution, sustainability
      
      innovation, ethical branding, risk communication and participatory engagement.

Avoiding reputational crises

I work with senior executives and boards to ensure unpredictable political, regulatory, media and societal risks don't distract and damage them and their organisations. 

Drawing on over 20 years of hands on practical experience working directly with chief executives and directors, I work with leaders to understand the actual risks they face, their triggers and drivers and, vitally, how to avoid those risks preventing leaders from achieving their goals. I work directly with clients, or through established advisory firms who draw on my deep insights and experiences.

Effective member organisations

I work with the leaders and boards of member based organisations who are frustrated their organisation lacks impact.  We draw on my own experiences in association leadership roles to work together on clear strategic goals, practical pathways to achieve them and how to ensure Board, member and staff commitment.

Success for new executives

I guide newly appointed and promoted executives who need an experienced sounding board or trusted adviser to help them succeed quickly in their new role.  We work together to get clarity about the new role and the expectations that go with it, develop support from their colleagues, avoid pitfalls and achieve some early demonstrable successes.

sjmunchenberg@civilitas.com.au

general.headline: Director, People & Culture at Leadbolt
general.description:
I am a highly established commercial Human Resources (HR) Leader with over 12 years of experience gained within the professional services, finance and technology industries.

I have led HR generalist teams and built HR functions both internally and externally.  My passion has always been within the HR generalist arena, building meaningful business partnering relationships and platforms that drive a results orientated culture and empowers people to be a part of something incredible, building engagement and organisational success through the value people bring and the contributions they make.

Expertise: Strategic and Operational HR, Diversity & Inclusion, M&A, Employee Relations, Change & Transformation, Organisational Development, Talent, Performance, Global and Internal Mobility, Recruitment/Talent Acquisition, Leadership and Executive Development, Coaching,Culture and Engagement, Organisational Brand/Identity, Developing "Great Places to Work", Workforce of the Future, Workforce Planning and Capability Development.

jobs.description:
Leadbolt is one of Australia’s fastest growing companies and the world’s leading mobile advertising, user acquisition and monetization platform.  With clients in over 165 countries, Leadbolt serves over 10 billion ads per month to its users. Leadbolt currently has offices in Sydney and Los Angeles and is expanding rapidly across the world.  

As the Director of People & Culture and a member of the Senior Leadership Team, I'm responsible for developing and driving the implementation of our People & Culture Strategy across Australia and our global region, including USA, India and EMEA.

Deloitte Australia provides a range of professional services - Audit, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. Our goal in connecting people is simple: we want to change our client's capacity to act.

The People & Performance (HR) team is critical to delivering on Deloitte’s vision to be the most inspiring firm to work with. We are known for our insight, navigating successful outcomes, and our ‘how might we?’ approach. We are proud of building a culture where our people can truly say ‘only at Deloitte’ and our successful engagement results over a number of years are testament to this approach.

As the HR Manager for Assurance & Advisory, I lead a team responsible for the design and implementation of our strategy across a diverse and always evolving national business.

ACE Group is one of the world’s largest multiline property and casualty insurers. ACE has been present in Australia for over 50 years. Its specialised and customised coverages include Marine, Property, Liability, Energy, Professional Indemnity, Directors & Officers, Financial Lines, Utilities as well as Accident & Health, for a broad client base, including many of the country’s largest companies. 

As the HR Business Partner for ACE Insurance I provided HR and commercial advice, solutions and consultation to senior leaders within the business and employees in offices nationally as well as having overall responsibility for specific HR functions such as employee relations and policy and procedure.

As the National HR Business Partner for Panasonic Australia, I partnered with Senior Leadership and the wider business to provide advice and support on all facets of HR, with a key focus of this role being the management of all ER.  Along with the Executive Team, I lead a team responsible for the design and execution of the strategy and strategic priorities as well as the development of the Panasonic people and growth of the iconic brand.

As the National HR Consultant for Bankwest Business, I worked to deliver strategic and
      operational HR generalist advice, working with the Business, Private & Commercial
      Banking groups to achieve their business objectives and deliver successful
      
      initiatives/outcomes for their people.

I worked within multiple roles throughout my 4 years at PwC, all within the Human Capital Team.  These roles ranged from generalist human resources, managing large scale graduate recruitment campaigns, global mobility, experienced and international recruitment, ER/IR, EVP employer branding and diversity and inclusion projects.  Whilst in the HC Relationship Manager role, my key client group was Advisory (Deals & Consulting).

As the HR Coordinator for Caxton St Catering, I was based off-site at QPAC.  I was
      accountable for staffing each of our venues and various hosted events.  I assisted in all
      generalist HR Coordinator duties, including large scale talent acquisition and
      
      supporting key HR projects.

general.headline: Special Counsel • Chairman • Director • Philanthropist
general.description:
Peter McMullin has an extensive legal and business career encompassing prominent roles in both the public and private sectors.

Currently, Peter is the Chairman and Director of McMullin Group, leads a dedicated team of professionals, providing strategic direction and financial management across a range of industries. He is also Special Counsel for Cornwall Stodart Lawyers, specialising in improving outcomes for the firm and its clients by facilitating meaningful connections between like-minded people in the area of business, politics, philanthropy and the arts within Melbourne and throughout Australia. 

Just some of Peter’s past-roles includes:
• Councillor and Deputy Lord Mayor, City of Melbourne 
• Councillor and Mayor, City of Greater Geelong
• President, VECCI
• Chairman,  Melbourne International Comedy Festival
• Deputy President, Museums Board of Victoria
• Board Member, Philanthropy Australia
• Board Member, Victorian Curriculum and Assessment Authority 
• Director, National Portrait Gallery of Australia
• President, Geelong Art Gallery

Peter has always had a deep-seated interest in community affairs and has used his experience wherever possible to further these causes. His belief is the private sector has an important role to play in leading to a resolution of many pressing social issues. Peter has spent his career forging positive, constructive partnerships between the private sector with governments, the not-for-profit sector and educational institutions.

As an active philanthropist, Peter seeks to collaborate with other individuals and organisations to maximise the impact of his contributions. A recent example is supporting the establishment of the world’s first academic Centre dedicated to the issue of Statelessness at Melbourne University Law School.

general.headline: CEO at Ansarada | The ready way to do business
general.description:
NEVER HAS THE SPEED OF BUSINESS PLACED A GREATER PREMIUM ON BUSINESS READINESS. 
For businesses and advisors that see opportunity in everything, Ansarada’s AI powered Material Information Platform illuminates a path from today to what’s next and positions businesses for success. 

We’ve run thousands of deals through our data room product and realised that a business is never better prepared or in better shape than at the end of a material deal, like raising funds or selling. Why wait for a make-or-break event to become aware, prepared and connected to the tools and advice needed be successful?  A material information platform makes it easy to put this wisdom to use in your business today and make what’s next visible and actionable now. 

HOPE IS NOT A STRATEGY, READINESS IS.
We’ve used data and built machine learning and AI tools based off previous deals and best practices from the world’s top companies & advisors. For material events like funding rounds and preparing for raising capital, an audit, licensing deals, through to getting ready for and executing a potential sale, acquisition, tender process or public listing, the ansarada material information platform gets advisors and businesses ready, set and going well. 

MY ROLE AS CEO?
Build a company people love to work for and products that revolutionise business and deal making. 

I study, practice and teach leadership. I challenge the status quo to unlock potential in the people, businesses and communities that I am privileged to serve. We’ve pledged 1 percent of ansarada’s equity, time and product to the Adara Group, a unique organization working to improve the lives of women and children in Nepal and Uganda.

GET IN TOUCH
Want to join a team that’s wired to care, rewards innovation and challenges the status quo?

general.headline: Lawyer and Consultant
general.description:
Chris Penman has extensive experience advising on general legal, governance and compliance obligations for businesses and institutions in the public and private sectors.

Having retired from The University of Melbourne in 2014, he is available for consultation and other appropriate engagements in these areas.

He was the General Counsel of The University from 2003 to 2012, and thereafter until 2014 as Special Counsel.  In both roles, he led the University's 'governance legal' activities, primarily referable to governance, compliance, trusts and project specific assignments.

Chris has tertiary legal qualifications from the Universities of Sydney, London and Melbourne as well as governance related accreditations from the Australian Institute of Company Directors and Chartered Secretaries Australia.

Chris spent most of his career in private legal practice with Baker & McKenzie commencing in Sydney in 1976, and was a corporate law partner in Hong Kong and Melbourne for 22 years before moving to the University in 2003.

He has been a member of the Council of the Law Institute of Victoria, and has current, or had prior, roles on a number of other charitable, sporting and not-for-profit organisations, so is well versed on the particular responsibilities and issues facing such bodies.

jobs.description:
At The University of Melbourne, Chris provided legal advice on a broad range of issues
      for the University, including key legal and governance issues pertaining to the
      University's dual role as a body corporate and body politic.  He was also actively
      involved in trusts and general advancement issues, and as the University Compliance
      Officer, oversaw delivery of the compliance program including regular reports to
      
      Council and the broader University community.

general.headline: Chief Executive Officer at Lean Sigma Institute & Lean Sigma Analytics P/L
general.company: Lean Sigma Analytics and Lean Sigma Institute
general.description:
Involved in Quality Management & improvement in Manufacturing & Services, tertiary teaching and consulting and training. This has included senior roles for an automotive supplier and in the service sector and lecturing at three Universities.  

My passion is coaching others to success - either project work, using data to make clever management decisions and personal development. Now on the MBA Advisory Board for LaTrobe University, focus being to align education with practitioner competencies.

My LSS experience has been gained through projects, deployment experience and academic research. Projects have been across all industry sectors together with the delivery of LSS training programs. Recently have been educating a company in data and predictive analysis and the importance of smart management decision for innovation and improvement.

Recently, had the privilege to be a chapter writer of a book on Leadership - Engaged Leadership
Transforming through Future-Oriented Design Thinking https://www.springer.com/gp/book/9783319722207 

My academic research has been across all industry sectors to develop a model for sustainable deployment of Continuous Improvement. My personal passion is in developing the interpersonal and mindfulness skills of others during the management of change. I have a doctorate in business administration, the thesis and published work focusing on competencies required in sustainable continuous improvement. 

Adopting standardization of competencies in CI is critical to successful deployment and one of our platforms to ensure this is met with the new International Standard for Lean & Six Sigma, namely  ISO18404.

Creating a culture of continuous improvement is our focus and a necessary condition for this is for everyone to understand more about their subconscious behaviors and patterns. The combination of quality improvement and emotional intelligence will lead to effective change as there will less impact from the subconscious.

jobs.companyName: Lean Sigma Analytics and Lean Sigma Institute

jobs.description:
The key focus of Lean Sigma Analytics Pty Ltd is to provide the true voice of the customer at the Organizational and strategic level so that Operational improvements are linked directly through a Governance process, much like Hoshin planning. We have an alliance with a large Software/Analytics provider to enable predictive models to be developed together with an Organizational dashboard to provide data, information and knowledge to a Board in order to drive sustainable continuous improvement.

Lean Sigma Institute has a strategic partnership with Information Builders, Leader in the 2015 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Data Quality, BI and Analytics. It also has an alliance with Prospecta, a provider of Master Data Governance and Work Safe Online, both critical to a CI program.

My business, Lean Sigma Institute has a key focus on creating a sustainable culture of continuous improvement - refer to our Web site www.leansigmainstitute.com.au for details. 

I work with a number of colleagues providing Lean Six Sigma training and coaching to all "Belt" levels. We have an alliance with a number of organizations including Systemix, a well know group of leaders in the infrastructure space and more recently with Strategic Centric providing a combined offering in Big Data Analytics and LSS. I also work with senior management teams in strategic leadership and implementation of strategy.

We also assist small companies in Quality Systems Management optimization using ISO9001 and Medical Device standards.

In addition to the automotive profile, Andrew has built a solid property portfolio in the UK & Australia. The Aqua Resort being the latest acquisition, an exclusive beach side holiday retreat situated in Western Australia’s Margaret River region.

With over 50 repair centres globally and continuously investing in people and resources, Andrew has established an elite network of associates and partners allowing his companies to accelerate while maintaining outstanding quality and service.

Global executive. Eglantine is a versatile global executive. She has delivered complex projects and led teams in 20 different countries in Europe, the US and Asia-Pacific in consulting and manufacturing. 

In-house transformer. Eglantine is a catalyst for innovation and business transformation, She has a demonstrable track record in projects as diverse as a new operating model with supporting ERP systems implementation, transformation through technology, mergers and acquisitions and introduction of new ways of working (introduction of Agile, flexible working arrangements).

Strategist. Eglantine has expertise in co-designing business strategy with executive peers, transforming business objectives and challenges into an IT strategy through leadership, collaboration and influence, and enabling executive peers to leverage IT effectively. 

Inspiring leader. Eglantine takes leadership seriously. She is able to articulate a clear vision, and her strategic clarity and understanding of human nature equip her to lead and mobilise even teams struggling with change. She is strongly committed to inclusion and has built teams that balance gender, age and background diversity. 

Coach and mentor. Eglantine provides informal coaching to her peers on how technology contributes to business transformation, cultural change or operational efficiency through curated articles, conferences, organised sessions with thought leaders and individual conversations. 

Startup founder. In her spare time, Eglantine is building Boomerang Factory, a startup that helps employees develop new skills and competencies through designed experiential learning happening via internships in other organisations.

general.headline: CIO/CTO/Head of Technology Innovation/Director of Emerging Technologies & Chief Agitator
general.description:
A BIT ABOUT ME

I am a veteran CIO/CTO and business leader who, together with my team, have embarked upon one of the biggest technology enabled business transformations in the organisation’s 150 year history. By embracing a new wave of disruptive technologies we plan to transform the Building and Construction supply markets.

I led a major technology transition at CSR, where the application of world-leading technology and operational excellence is viewed by executive management & Board as a clear point of strategic differentiation.  As a result, CSR IT is delivering world-class digital platforms such as visualisers, external facing sites, CRM, B2B and B2C platforms; more agile IT infrastructure, and is innovating across its technology portfolio, from online self-service customer platforms, to mobile enabled enterprise applications at the construction site, through to developing an industrialised process for integrating M&A’s.  

I am an advocate of open systems, cloud computing and on-demand infrastructure, I am always looking at what opportunities and challenges lay ahead for the industry.  

I am fascinated by trends in social media, mobility and big data especially in the context of global, social and political issues. 

I believe in the generosity of the human spirit – and that as individuals we can make a difference on this planet.     

MY SKILL SET

TECHNOLOGY & BUSINESS STRATEGY - TRANSFORMATION & CHANGE LEADERSHIP – IT GOVERNANCE BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT – BUSINESS TURNAROUND – SAP ERP IMPLEMENTATION - PROCESS RE-ENGINEERING BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE & ANALYSIS - PMO ESTABLISHMENT & MANAGEMENT – VENDOR MANAGEMENT MARKET ANALYSIS - COMPLIANCE - FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT & COST CONTROL - TRANSITION TO HYBRID CLOUD - IOT & SENSOR TECHNOLOGY LINKED TO SUPPLY CHAIN PROCESS

jobs.jobTitle: Chief Technology Officer / Director of Emerging Technologies
jobs.description:
We are witnessing the ingredients of the perfect storm! 
Our customer base right across Australia and APAC is facing unprecedented cost pressure on managing operating expenses relating to energy, water and waste; coupled with the ongoing battle for improved customer experience through a contextualised & personalised digital engagement.    
We have reached a tipping point where disruptive technologies & the industrial internet is gaining steam at an exponential rate. Powered by next generation connectivity such as 5G & NB-IoT, embedded sensor technology, smart grid, deep ML and Mesh compute as a new wave of disruptive technologies fuelling a new wave of business innovation. 
As a member of the SingTel/Optus group, I am privileged to be part of an inspiring team - charged with building and commercialising intelligent digital infrastructure, separating hype from reality.

jobs.companyName: NSW Department of Family & Community Services – Business Services (Formerly NSW Businesslink)
jobs.description:
The NSW Government is transferring its disability services to the non-government sector by June 2018.  The transfer of disability services supports the transition to the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS), and will create a vibrant disability services market that will give people with disability greater choice.
I have responsibility to transition all of Clinical Support Services to The Benevolent Society. My remit has end-2-end responsibility across all functional streams – HR, Legal, Finance, Operations, IT, Change Management & Communications.

With a team of over 100 people (including contingent workforce), ~ 6 major technology partners & a complex reporting structure to the CFO, CEO/MD and Board, key responsibilities included the Governance of all Technology strategy projects & end-2-end responsibility for all IT Services across the CSR Group of companies.     

I conceived the vision, developed the strategy & plan to deliver an online customer self service portal digitising the customer "tradie" experience & thereby digitising the end-2-end customer supply chain. Viewed by Management & Board as pivotal in delivering against one of CSR’s key strategic planks, enabling the business to exploit disruptive technologies to increase the frequency & depth of engagement with the customer. 

I successfully delivered the technology workstreams of 2 major divestments: firstly, the Sucrogen & Energy Renewables business to a Singaporean conglomerate Wilmar, and secondly the APAC Insulation business to Rockwool International in Europe. Following the completion of both divestitures, I then embarked upon an IT enabled business transformation reaffirming CSR's market leadership position in the building and construction supply markets in the ANZ region. 

I delivered against a series of bolt-on acquisitions across Australia and New Zealand, close to core expansions integrating the newly acquired businesses with existing product lines. Most noteworthy was the Boral east coast bricks JV/Acquisition supporting CSR’s strategy for accelerated/profitable growth through targeted M&A

I partnered with the Chairman of CSR’s Risk and Audit Board to deliver CSR’s IT and Cyber security vision and plan, in sympathy with CSR's technology strategy transition to a mobile centric, hybrid-cloud IT model.

With a team of over 60 people across Asia Pacific region, ~ 6 major technology partners & a complex reporting structure to the local COO, CEO and APAC CIO.  Key responsibilities included the Governance of all technology strategy projects and hosting of mission critical business systems and regional IT infrastructure services.     

I developed a business case justification for streamlining the global supply chain process by integrating Alcatel’s regional SAP R/3 solutions across Europe and Asia Pacific. A major business driver for this project was to reduce equipment supply lead times by 40% in support of contractual obligations with key customers’ in Australia and New Zealand.   
	
I delivered the IT integration & consolidation plan in support of the merge between Alcatel and Lucent (ALU). Key elements of the business integration included the following technology enablers:

1. Migration of ALU’s opportunity pipeline and order forecasting into one global Siebel (CRM) solution 
2. Migration of ALU’s finance, project financial accounting, supply chain execution & sourcing into one SAP R/3 solution
3. Consolidation of Voice solutions including VOIP leveraging ALU technologies 

The above was delivered within a 12 month time horizon involving 15 countries across APAC. 

I conceived the vision and plan for establishing a Sydney based IT Data Centre with SAP R/3 as the core business system enabling a common business processing centre compromising of back office transactional finance, supply chain & other operational functions. This shared service capability was successfully adopted by 15 countries across the APAC region.

ASB is a joint venture company between Alcatel and Shanghai Bell and is currently Alcatel’s largest internal manufacturing facility worldwide.

During 2003/2004, I was seconded to the role as IT Director ASB to help deliver against a major business transformation. 

I was part of a team (business & IT) that successfully delivered on a major business model reconfiguration concerning the global supply chain, logistics execution & manufacturing business processes for ASB. This project brought about the following business improvements: 
1. 200% improvement in visibility over cost of goods sold                       
2. 100% uptake in business adoption of process improvements within SAP R/3, enabling business data such as customer orders & forecasts to drive production planning
3. Upgrade of SAP Software to introduce system stability

Technology when used for good can change the world.

general.headline: Chief Technology Officer at Melbourne Water
general.description:
I am the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) of the Victorian State Government owned Melbourne Water. In my 25 year career as an accomplished Senior Executive, I have delivered tangible contributions to organisations through technology transformation to support business strategy and growth. 

Core to my success has been my ability to create a shared technology vision, delivered through the development and leadership of high performing teams. 

I am a member of the Australian Computer Society's Professional Education Governance Committee and am passionate about rectifying the gender diversity imbalance in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathemetics (STEM). I am a former member of the Financial Service Council’s Infrastructure Committee. I chaired the swimEC (superannuation, wealth and investment management Electronic Commerce) Sub-Committee which launched the swimEC standards, the precursor to new SuperStream standards (https://www.ato.gov.au/super/superstream). I maintain an active interest in the not-for-profit sector.

I speak by invitation nationally in the areas of eCommerce, Technology Transformation and IT Leadership.

I hold a Masters in Business Administration [MBA Executive] from the Australian Graduate School of Management (AGSM), I am Graduate of the Australian Institute of Company Directors, past Associate Fellow of the Australian Institute of Management and a member of the AGSM Alumni. 

Specialties: Strategic Planning, IT Operations, Start-ups & SME’s, Risk & Compliance, Stakeholder Management, Program/Project Management, Software Development, Financial Management, High-Performing Teams

jobs.jobTitle: Various IT roles to Program Director
jobs.description:
NAB rationalised its IT divisions in Australia, New Zealand and Asia into a single services organisation known as Asia-Pacific Integration (API). As a Programme Director, my responsibilities were to establish and lead two of the programmes required to achieve this integration. In these roles, I achieved the following:

•	development and approval of programme Business Cases. 
•	establishment of Steering Committees with relevant IT and business representation. 
•	establishment of the projects required to achieve the integration. 
The Channel Services programme decoupled core business applications from the channels that delivered their functionality (e.g., Internet, branch, EFTPOS). A message-based architecture enabled the delivery of business functions across multiple channels without ‘re-inventing the wheel’ as new channels were introduced. Once the programme was underway, but prior to its completion, I moved to establish the HR programme.

jobs.description:
As General Manager of Automotive Aftermarket for Bosch Oceania I have responsibility for supply, logistics, sales and marketing of automotive spare parts across Australia and New Zealand.  Servicing more than 200 customers across 14 product categories / 30,000 SKUs to more than 1,300 delivery points.

Beyond spare parts the Bosch team also sell workshop test equipment, training and aftersales services to all automotive repair shops. In addition we manage (franchise model) the Bosch Service Network in Oceania, with over 350 car repair locations covering car service, diesel service and Auto electrical specialists. Our services customer base has 1000+ customers across brand concepts, training and software offers.

The GM Commercial had accountability for bulk fuel and lubricants sales servicing a broad range of customers throughout Australia, delivering approximately 5 billion litres per annum  of fuel (approx $6b in revenue), literally “fuelling” Australian business.  The division was split into 3 sectors; Industrial, Branded Wholesale & Liberty. 

The Industrial team looked after mining and other resource sector customers including the provision of technical services. The mining sector was dominated by large tenders for supply of product and technical services for 3-5 year periods requiring sophisticated bid management, extensive negotiations and key account management over the life of the contract. Viva Energy held a high market share in this sector, operating complex supply chains for Australia's top mining companies with need for continuous improvement in the areas of cost efficiencies, safety and innovation.  

The Branded Wholesale team looked after both wholesalers and 200+ 3rd party Shell branded service stations. Wholesalers purchased on both term and spot contracts ex refinery / terminal gate with most customers holding contracts with multiple suppliers requiring a constant focus on being competitive, whilst monitoring credit viability. Under license from Shell Viva Energy managed the relationship with over 200 single site service station owners who contracted to Viva Energy for the right to be branded Shell. These contracts provided use of the Shell brand whilst requiring the service station to meet certain standards and also purchase 100% of their fuel needs from Viva Energy. In addition this division also took on the responsibility for establishing a new model of Shell branded commission agent service stations. 

The Liberty team looked after the relationship with Liberty Australia, a major Wholesaler and Retail nationally. Viva Energy is a shareholder and a supplier to Liberty who also manage a number of Shell branded service stations.

general.headline: Global speaker, success coach, facilitator, creator,  founding director at Who Am I Projects and author of Read Me First.
general.description:
Lisa challenges the status quo. You’ll find her curiosity captivating – so much so that you’ll be well out of your comfort zone before you even realise you were on your way.  You know they say the harder you work the luckier you get? Lisa Stephenson is one of the lucky ones. Lisa knows how to hit the mark. She looks beyond the obvious, peeling apart the layers by asking the right questions at the right time. She makes the connections, builds the relationships, digging deeper and aiming higher.  As the founding Director of Who Am I Projects, Lisa successfully combines accreditations, skills and experience with an incredible sense of curiosity, intuition and compassion. She’s also a diehard 80’s fan (don’t judge), although she doesn’t mind the occasional 90’s rock (and, naturally, is totally obsessed with Adele). 
After starting her career with a Bachelor of Arts in Management Communication and a Certificate IV in Workplace Assessment & Training, Lisa graduated from the renowned Life Coaching Academy. She became driven to combine all three disciplines, guiding and supporting people to be the very best version of themselves, both professionally and personally.

Lisa’s book Read Me First is now available www.readmefirst.com.au

jobs.description:
Lisa and her team specialise in working with individuals and organisations on learning projects that have at their core talent development, executive coaching, corporate ‘storytelling’, networking events and ‘stretch’ experiences.  The greatest learning happens in discomfort!

As a keynote speaker, Lisa works across Australia, Asia, N.Z and the U.S.  Setting the challenge for audiences around the world, in understanding you are your most important project.  

Of note, Lisa has developed and managed the highly regarded THRIVE talent development experience for the National Australia Bank over the past 8 years (Australia and Asia), as well as Telstra’s THE DYNAMIC talent development experience, Treasury Wine Estate’s VERAISON program, and Macquarie Bank’s SHINE experience for women in banking. Also of note is the leadership work delivered for Australian Unity.  There lots of work we can that the team can't tell you about! 

Her passion lies in supporting people to be the best version of themselves, and to achieve their best life in a holistic way. She will engage, challenge, inspire, and hold people accountable for going after what they want! People are taken to that higher level of achievement where they will know what they didn’t know before and will start acting on that gap between where they are and where they want to be. They will know more about what success (and happiness) means for them and what they need to do to achieve it.

Many will testify that Lisa’s approach is informal and intuitive.  She works with great passion and warmth, and with a strong commitment to results. Her workshops and 'projects' are relevant, high impact and fun.  Lisa has built a strong brand around her trusting and robust client relationships.  Clients will be happy to testify not only to how much she cares, but also how she tells the truth, provides meaningful feedback and takes pleasure in asking the powerful questions they haven’t even thought of yet.

schools.description: As well as a Bachelor of Arts Degree in Management Communication, Lisa has a Certificate IV in Workplace Assessment and Training, is a graduate of the renowned Life Coaching Academy, and has a number of other accreditations and licences.

Website: www.ontalent.com.au | www.ontalentjobs.com.au


Natasha is Chief Executive and Partner of OnTalent, an exciting venture launched with former Manpower Colleague Varina Nissen.  OnTalent specialises in Executive and specialist recruitment with a focus on robust assessment of both competence and fit - 'connecting people to purpose'.

OnTalent has quickly emerged as a firm of choice for organisations looking for exemplary customer service and creative solutions to sourcing at the most senior levels.
Natasha has more than 20 years recruitment industry experience  and is a successful consultant in the executive, NFP and newly formed strategic positions.  For the past 15 years she held senior management and leadership positions both nationally and state based. 

Natasha began her career with PricewaterhouseCoopers where she spent nearly six years providing executive recruitment to clients of the firm as well as providing recruitment and workforce planning to the firm for major projects and key executive internal roles.  Her experience included leading teams in group assessments, executive placement and psychometric assessment before moving to Deloitte as Director of their Queensland Resources practice.  

Wanting to diversify her career Natasha spent nearly 2 years as an Executive Search consultant with a well known boutique firm specializing in Executive Search in the Executive and specialist engineering sectors before leading a large Commercial recruitment team for a national recruitment player.

Natasha enjoys developing the capability of her team and drives the highest professional standards.  She is recognised as a Fellow of the RCSA and contributes as Vice Chair of the Qld/NT Council.

Specialties: Leadership, leading the appointment of critical 'for purpose' roles, finding talent for new strategic directions.

jobs.description:
Foodbank Queensland is a non-denominational community supported, non-profit organisation which relies on the support of a large network of dedicated people who have a commitment to fulfilling the aims and objectives of Foodbank Queensland. 

The concept of Foodbank Queensland is simple – to feed the country’s needy by redistributing surplus food. 

Food growers, manufacturers and processors produce quantities of food which, for various commercial reasons, cannot be sold. The products may be incorrectly labelled, have faulty packaging, be part of a trial run or are not produced to exact specifications. 

It is estimated that as much as 30% of all food produced is unsaleable for a variety of reasons. 

Increasingly, welfare agencies are involved in an on-going struggle to provide food relief to thousands of people who are dependant on food handouts to supplement their welfare benefits. 

Foodbank Queensland is the link between these two groups. Foodbank provides an outlet to food companies for their surplus stock and at the same time, allows community support agencies to save time and resources in the solicitation of nutritious food.
Queensland's largest not for profit food rescue charity

general.headline: Strategist | Innovative Thinker | Inspiring People to Uncover their Purpose and Create Impact
general.description:
In everything I do, I believe in challenging the status quo and I'm passionate about empowering people to reach their potential. I’m fascinated by the drivers of human behaviour and how I can influence others to deliver positive, sustainable outcomes. 

I'm entirely dedicated to helping people be their best and create positive impact – this is regardless of where I am placed in an organisation, whether directly influencing through training and coaching teams or through the development and implementation of strategic initiatives. 

Give me a problem to solve, a challenge to overcome or a mindset to change and I’ll do it. I ask questions. I observe. I challenge. I engage. I create. I respect the inherent value each person contributes and believe that it is only with diversity of thought and diversity of skill that you can achieve great things. I believe in people.

I pride myself on being eternally positive and always look for the learning from every experience. I believe attitude is everything.

If any of the above resonates, I’d love to chat! Shoot me a message and we can share some ideas.

general.headline: Chief Marketing Officer | Marketing and Business Leadership | Creativity and Innovation
general.description:
If you’re a business owner or leader, you’ll know that it’s never been harder to focus, optimise and quantify your marketing efforts in an era of massive media and channel disruption. With the customer in control it’s now crucial, but is it possible?

Put simply. Yes.

I am a precise, decisive and customer centric marketer with a proven track record of delivering results to business - both as an advertising agency partner and a senior marketing leader. My breadth of experience has made me fluent in commercial imperatives, results focus and delivery; while my advertising and creative credentials have also been proven time and again. By combining business strategy, integrated marketing and creativity into business operations I’ve consistently improved business outcomes.

Just as importantly I'm a strong leader, deeply digitally savvy, a force for positivity, high energy, love people and am deeply curious about what makes us all tick.

jobs.jobTitle: Head of Group Media, Sponsorship, Events, Agencies, Digital and Social Media
jobs.description:
In this role I lead 40+ people to deliver these functional portfolios across the Westpac Group in Australia.

Leading the Sponsorship and Events across properties such as Westpac Rescue Helicopters, Westpac / Fairfax City2 series, Open Air Cinema, eSports League, GWS Giants, Queensland Reds, St.George Dragons, Adelaide Fringe, Adelaide Royal Show, Port Adelaide Power, Melbourne Food and Wine Festival, amongst others to provide improved business returns.

Leading the Media team developed a bespoke media agency model known as Media Lab that uses media science to lower cost per acquisition, improve efficiency and generate outcomes - while providing an engaged agency team delivering the future of media today, under a transparent media contract.

Leading the Social team to improve customer service with lower time to serve and significantly improved engagement metrics.  Developed strategies to improve reach, find new ways to assist customers during technical challenges, and oversaw development and implementation of the Group’s highest reach campaigns.  Implemented a social centre of excellence.

Leading the Digital Performance and Programmatic Sales team drove significant improvements in media efficiency and understanding. Structured for a dramatic improvement in performance and display innovation including onsite scoring capability.  Co-led governance of Double Click AdServing capability across the Group brands.

Leading Agency team to improve retainer and utilisation efficiency, providing savings through removal of duplicated capability and developing future ready contracts to ensure performance and flexibility.

I’m also the key client contact for the Map & Page PR team and have integrated them into the broader team to develop more connected go-to-market plans for campaigns and activities, deeper understanding of the Westpac business, contributed to the building of capability and assisted with prioritisation and commercial return with that embedded team.

As Head of Brand and Marketing for BankSA I led the Marketing functions for the brand alongside the BankSA CEO, Westpac Group CMO and BankSA Leadership Team to rebuild the iconic BankSA brand.

Key deliverables, amongst others, included leadership of the Marketing function, strategic realignment of sponsorship properties, greater commercial focus, talent development and a new (widely recognised and awarded) campaign known as Piping Shrike to bring consistency to communications.

Across three years of work the brand has returned to #1 in consideration, seen brand measures return to positive trending after a decade of decline and built deep marketing capability.  Working closely with the General Managers of Retail, Commercial and SME Banking has generated consistently positive customer and revenue growth.

The BankSA brand health clearly indicates a bright future for this iconic brand.

This role was carried out concurrently to Head of Group Media, Sponsorship, Events, Agencies, Digital and Social Media functional role.

general.headline: Chief Executive, Consumer Bank at Westpac Group
general.description:
George was appointed Chief Executive of Westpac Group’s Consumer Bank in June 2015 and is responsible for managing the end to end relationship with consumer customers. This includes all consumer banking products and services under the Westpac, St.George, BankSA, Bank of Melbourne and RAMS brands.  

Prior to this appointment, George was CEO, St.George Banking Group. He joined the Westpac Group in March 2009 as Chief Executive, Westpac New Zealand Limited. Formerly George was Group Executive General Manager at National Australia Bank and prior to that, a senior executive in Commonwealth Bank of Australia's Institutional Banking Division.  He has also been a partner with the Boston Consulting Group and an officer in the Royal Australian Air Force.

In addition to being one of Australia’s most experienced financial services executives, George is a highly sought after board and advisory committee executive.  His current positions include;
•  Chair, Prime Minister’s Industry Advisory Committee on Veterans’ Employment
•  Chair, St George Bank
•  Board member, Bank of Melbourne
•  Governor, St George Foundation
•  Co-founder, Head Start Homes
•  Advisory Committee, UNSW Business School 

George is a passionate supporter and actively involved with numerous charities, including;
•  Amnesty 2020, Council member 
•  St Vincent’s Curran Foundation 
•  The Hellenic Initiative, board member

jobs.description:
George is responsible for managing the end to end relationship with consumer
      customers across all consumer banking products and services under the Westpac,
      St.George, BankSA, Bank of Melbourne and RAMS brands.
      

    
      

    Westpac’s Consumer Bank is comprised of approximately 11,000 employees, and has a
      strong distribution network with more than 1,100 branches across Australia.

A division of Westpac Banking Corporation, St.George Banking Group is comprised of 4,600 people working across the St.George Bank, Bank of Melbourne, BankSA and RAMS brands. St.George Banking Group experienced tremendous momentum under George’s leadership with six positives halves of growth; cash earnings (profit after tax) increased by 14% in the 2014 financial year and 17% in the 2013 financial year. In the first half of the 2015 financial year, St.George Banking Group was the largest contributor to Westpac Group's cash earnings growth

George had full end-to-end responsibility for Westpac New Zealand’s retail, business,
      wealth and institutional businesses. He was instrumental in improving the performance
      of the Westpac New Zealand business, with cash earnings tripling over the three years
      
      and home loans growing at twice the banking system average.

general.headline: Head of Marketing at RAMS Financial Group
general.description:
Christian (CJ) was appointed Head of Marketing, RAMS Financial Group in December 2015. 
Since 1995, RAMS has been helping Australians realise the ‘Great Australian Dream’ of owning their own home. RAMS has done that through an extensive and innovative range of home loans and flexible options - making it affordable for people to own their home. In May 2012, RAMS launched savings and transaction accounts.

CJ was formerly the Head of Marketing, Consumer Finance for the Westpac Group of brands in Australia and has been in the role since March 2012. CJ’s responsibilities included customer acquisition, lifecycle management, loyalty and project marketing implementation for the Westpac Group for both consumer and business segments. 

Prior to Consumer Finance, CJ was the Head of Acquisition Marketing for St George Bank where he was responsible for overseeing the acquisition marketing communication strategy and implementation of the marketing communications plan for the Retail (Consumer) business.

Prior to his role at St George Bank, CJ was GM, Marketing Campaign Management at Telstra, a position he held since 2006. 

Before Telstra, CJ was with IBM for 13 years working in a number of Marketing Management & Marketing Communications positions in Australia, UK and Europe, including the management of the Wimbledon Tennis championships campaign in 2004 and 05.

CJ is a member of the Chartered Institute of Marketing & Australian Marketing Institute, and has studied in both Australia and the UK.

jobs.description:
Since we were founded in the Queensland outback in 1920 as Queensland and Northern Territory Aerial Services Limited, Qantas has grown to be Australia's largest domestic and international airline. 

With a reputation for excellence in safety, operational reliability, engineering, maintenance and customer service, we are widely regarded as the world's leading long distance airline and one of Australia’s strongest and most iconic brands.

People have always been at the core of Qantas. Today, our Group's main business is providing air travel for people from Australia and around the world through our two complementary airline brands - Qantas and Jetstar. We also operate a broad portfolio of subsidiary businesses. These include regional, domestic and international airline brands, Qantas Freight Enterprises and Qantas Frequent Flyer, as well as businesses in specialist markets such as Q Catering.

We’re proud to employ over 30,000 people, with approximately 93 per cent of them based in Australia.

general.headline: Managing Partner at Koda Capital
general.description:
I am a passionate and progressive leader of people with a strong track record of building and growing financial services businesses through a genuine focus on growth and the customer experience. 

I believe in leading with integrity and the shared values between an organisation and its people. I am at home in the digital realm and the possibilities that technology brings to businesses and consumers alike excites me. 

I bring a contemporary, forward looking and growth oriented approach to organisations. I value collaboration and partnership, and care about people, culture and the purpose of a business. The prospect of making a contribution to the ongoing prosperity of my community, my city and our unique place in the dynamic Asia Pacific region is a major motivational force for me.

My experience has encompassed all aspects of business management : strategy and business plan development, financial management and balance sheet management, full P&L accountability, operational management, governance and compliance frameworks, risk management, sales and distribution models, business development, relationship management, marketing and brand and business ambassadorship.

jobs.description:
My role is to lead and grow the Koda Capital business in Victoria. 

At Koda, we choose to be different. If you have ever felt the world of financial services is entrenched in practices that work against your needs, you are not alone. Koda Capital was founded by a group of highly experienced investment professionals who recognised the need to change things for the better. 

I lead a team that is proudly independent, highly specialised, experienced and has a razor sharp focus on the client. The financial advice we provide is genuinely independent and trustworthy, with no conflicts of interest and no favoured product alignments. Our sole focus is wealth management for private clients and non-profit investors, which optimises our specialist knowledge and positions our clients' needs as our first priority. Our advisers and other team members are some of the industry's most experienced wealth professionals, and have outstanding track records in client service. We believe that as advisers we should be rewarded according to the strength of our client relationships and the success of our financial strategies, not by our ability to promote specific products.

Good Cycles is a social enterprise using bicycles to engage, empower, educate and
      find employment for, at-risk youth and long term unemployed. It runs a growing range
      
      of commercial enterprises to support its engagement and vocational social programs.

We’re like-minded senior executives connecting over a shared passion for cycling.
      

    The active network for influential people.
      

    A safe place to freely share and exchange ideas, to grow both personally and
      
      professionally.

general.headline: Coach | Finance Executive.
general.description:
The following is a brief summary of what I am currently doing, and what I have achieved.

As you will see, I have a huge passion for people and performance. This will ultimately be judged by numbers, but it is bigger than that. Its the complete package, its the impact you have on others and that 'little bit of magic' that is left after you leave. 

When someone wants to know more about you and the connection they have sensed.

My interests include personal fitness having completed in many challenges, and still challenging myself everyday. 

I also play an integral role in the Community in my role as Vice President of the Carlton Alliance Precinct , the synergy between Traders and Residents.

My passion for Small Business ignited when I was 8 years old, working in the family business. I have worked in Corporate, I have worked in Private Enterprise while owning and operating a small business. I know what it takes to be successful.

As I said, its bigger than the numbers. its the Relationship and the Investment that you are prepared to put in.

Thank you.

general.school: University of Melbourne - Melbourne Business School
general.description:
Michelle Terry is an ASX 50 Executive with 20 years experience in Strategic, General Management, Marketing, and eCommerce leadership roles in international blue-chip organisations. 

She has worked across the consumer goods, retail, financial services and professional services sectors in Australia, Asia, Europe, the US, Canada and Latin America. 

Michelle's current role is Chief Marketing Officer, Americas. Previously, she was Marketing Director and Ecommerce strategy lead for Asia, Europe, MEA, LatAm and Global Travel Retail. She was also Global Marketing Director, Penfolds. Penfolds is Australia's most iconic fine wine house and an internationally recognised luxury brand. It is the most profitable brand owned by Treasury Wine Estates, an ASX 100 company and the world's largest pure play wine business. Another prior role was Managing Director: Lindeman’s, Yellowglen, WA and Tasmanian wines at Treasury Wine Estates, managing a portolio that comprised 18 brands and 10 million cases of wine sold globally.

Michelle has the proven ability to drive growth, manage a P&L and cross-functional teams, and lead strategic initiatives. She combines executive team experience, commercial accumen and a passion for brands and marketing with leadership, analytic, creative-thinking, people management, and stakeholder management skills.

Michelle holds an MBA from Melbourne Business School, and honors degrees in Arts - Psychology (The University of Queensland) and Business (Queensland University of Technology). She is a University Medallist (UQ), with a GPA in the top 0.1% of graduates. She is also a Graduate of the Australian Institute of Company Directors (GAICD) and a member of the Young Presidents Organisation (YPO).
